metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9293 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The config_auth function in ntpd in NTP before 4.2.7p11, when an auth key is not configured, improperly generates a key, which makes it easier for remote attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms via a brute-force attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9293` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.1
ntpdate - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> upstream commit in 4.2.7p11 removes automatic key generation completely. Red Hat fixed the issue in a different way.

criterions.comment: ntp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.1').
